_note: This is SOURCE DATA for import, not a direct database dump. The sync script (lib/jobs/sync-agency-catalogs.server.ts) transforms this into agency_course_templates records by: (1) Looking up agencyId from certification_agencies where code='ssi', (2) Mapping levelCode to levelId via certification_levels lookup, (3) Generating contentHash from course fields, (4) Adding sourceType='static_json', timestamps, etc. Tenant-specific fields (price, isActive, etc.) are NOT in this file - they're set when tenants import courses.

courses.name: Try Scuba
courses.description: Try Scuba Diving is a program designed to give you a taste of scuba diving without committing to a certification or diving in deep water. The program lasts around 3 hours combining basic theory and one shallow water session in a pool or shallow ocean to a maximum depth of 5 meters.

courses.name: Basic Diver
courses.description: The Basic Diver course gives you the skills you need to dive safely with a professional alongside you. It is a mixture of one theory session, a confined water session in shallow water, and an open water session to a maximum depth of 12 meters. This course can be credited towards the Scuba Diver or Open Water Diver certifications.

courses.name: Scuba Diver
courses.description: The SSI Scuba Diver certification is the first official SSI scuba diving certification. The course consists of three theory sessions, two shallow water confined dives, and two open water dives. Upon completion, you will be certified to dive to a maximum of 12 meters with a professional always with you.

courses.name: Open Water Diver
courses.description: The SSI Open Water Diver program is SSI's globally recognized certification. Complete all academic sections, pool/confined water sessions, and at least four open water training dives. Upon completion, you become part of an exclusive group of underwater explorers certified to dive anywhere in the world.

courses.name: Advanced Adventurer
courses.description: The SSI Advanced Adventurer program allows you to try 5 different Specialty dives before committing to a full training program. You will complete one open water training dive per specialty after a comprehensive briefing with your SSI Instructor. Dives completed can be applied toward full Specialty certifications.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Diver Stress and Rescue
courses.description: Learn to identify stress, prevent accidents, and discover rescue diver skills with the SSI Diver Stress and Rescue program. With a combination of pool and open water practice sessions, you will become well prepared and confident at handling emergency and rescue situations.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent, React Right certification recommended

courses.name: React Right
courses.description: React Right is SSI's emergency first response course providing training and knowledge to act as a first responder in a medical emergency. This flexible program covers primary assessment, first aid, CPR, primary stabilization techniques, oxygen administration in diving emergencies, and Automated External Defibrillator (AED) basics.

courses.name: Deep Diving
courses.description: The SSI Deep Diving Specialty teaches you to dive to depths between 18 and 40 meters through academic sessions and open water dives. Learn to plan and safely complete deep diving adventures using computers and gas consumption calculations.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Wreck Diving
courses.description: The SSI Wreck Diving Specialty allows you to discover the world of wreck diving and immerse in living history. Learn the knowledge and techniques needed to safely conduct non-penetration wreck dives, practice using reels and tethers, and develop buoyancy control and navigation skills.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Night Diving and Limited Visibility
courses.description: The SSI Night Diving and Limited Visibility specialty provides all the knowledge and skills you need to safely and comfortably dive at night or in limited visibility conditions. Learn how to enter and exit the water, use specialized equipment, and communicate with your buddy at night.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Navigation
courses.description: The SSI Navigation Specialty program helps you become a better, more confident diver who always knows where they are going. Learn how to use a dive compass, natural navigation techniques, and more.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Perfect Buoyancy
courses.description: The SSI Perfect Buoyancy Specialty improves your body position for relaxed dives, lowers your air consumption, and increases your bottom times. Master buoyancy control techniques for safer, more enjoyable diving.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Search and Recovery
courses.description: The SSI Search and Recovery Specialty teaches you the skills and techniques to conduct underwater searches and recover lost objects. Learn various search patterns and proper lift bag techniques.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Enriched Air Nitrox
courses.description: The SSI Enriched Air Nitrox specialty teaches you to plan and conduct dives using enriched air nitrox mixtures up to 40% oxygen. Extend your no-decompression limits and shorten surface intervals.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Recreational Sidemount Diving
courses.description: The SSI Recreational Sidemount course teaches you to go single or two-cylinder recreational sidemount diving up to a maximum depth of 30 meters. Experience greater flexibility and freedom of movement with tanks positioned along the sides of your body.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Boat Diving
courses.description: The SSI Boat Diver Specialty teaches you the skills and techniques needed to safely and comfortably dive from a variety of boats. Learn boat diving etiquette, entry and exit techniques, and emergency procedures.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Dry Suit Diving
courses.description: The SSI Dry Suit Diving Specialty allows you to dive all year, anywhere in the world while staying warm on every dive adventure. Learn dry suit operation, buoyancy control, and emergency procedures.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Equipment Techniques
courses.description: The SSI Equipment Techniques Specialty provides in-depth knowledge of scuba equipment operation, maintenance, and basic repairs. Understand how your gear works and learn to perform routine maintenance.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Photo and Video
courses.description: The SSI Photo and Video specialty provides in-depth knowledge to dive with an underwater camera and properly use, maintain, and store your equipment. Develop skills to take underwater images and video safely while perfecting your diving abilities.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Marine Ecology
courses.description: The SSI Marine Ecology specialty helps divers gain a thorough understanding of the oceans and the exciting science of marine ecology. Learn how ocean ecosystems interact and become an underwater naturalist.

courses.name: Shark Ecology
courses.description: The SSI Shark Ecology program teaches you to interpret shark behaviors, understand why they are often misunderstood, and how to dive with sharks safely. Perfect for shark fans and divers who want to overcome their fear.

courses.name: Sea Turtle Ecology
courses.description: The SSI Sea Turtle Ecology program teaches you to identify sea turtles, discover their vital role in marine ecosystems, and learn about their fascinating history and the threats to their survival.

courses.name: Manta and Ray Ecology
courses.description: The SSI Manta and Ray Ecology program teaches you to dive with mantas and other rays safely, plus discover the vital role they play in ocean ecosystems. Learn how to recognize different species.

courses.name: Fish Identification
courses.description: The SSI Fish Identification specialty teaches you to identify fish and enhance your dives. Learn to identify common families of Caribbean, Indo-Pacific, and Red Sea reef fish.

courses.name: Coral Identification
courses.description: The SSI Coral Identification Specialty teaches you to identify common families of coral species and enjoy diving these incredible underwater ecosystems. Discover the wonders of coral reefs.

courses.name: Marine Mammal Ecology
courses.description: The SSI Marine Mammal Ecology program teaches you about marine mammals, their behaviors, and how to safely interact with them in the wild. Learn to help protect ocean wildlife.

courses.name: Science of Diving
courses.description: The SSI Science of Diving Specialty immerses you in physics, physiology, decompression theory, and the aquatic environment. This program provides half the knowledge needed to earn your Divemaster rating.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Waves, Tides and Currents
courses.description: The SSI Waves, Tides and Currents specialty enhances your dive skills and understanding, so you can enjoy diving in different environments safely. Learn about environmental conditions that affect dive sites and practice evaluating diving conditions.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Ice Diving
courses.description: The SSI Ice Diving program provides the skills and concepts required to safely and comfortably dive underneath the ice. Experience polar diving and explore frozen underwater landscapes.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver and Dry Suit Diving certifications, or equivalent

courses.name: Scooter/DPV Diving
courses.description: The SSI Scooter/DPV Diving specialty teaches you the skills and concepts needed to safely plan and conduct dives using scooters or diver propulsion vehicles. Learn special precautions, buddy contact techniques, and equipment control.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Computer Diving
courses.description: The SSI Computer Diving program goes beyond teaching basic dive computer functions. Gain in-depth knowledge of decompression theory and how it relates to your dive computer operation, including differences between nitrox, mixed-gas, rebreather, and freediving computers.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: Gas Blender Nitrox
courses.description: The SSI Gas Blender Nitrox program teaches you the skills and concepts required to safely blend nitrox gases. This non-diving program is open to certified and uncertified divers and teaches proper usage of mathematics, gas blending software, physics, and techniques.

courses.name: Gas Blender Trimix
courses.description: The SSI Gas Blender Trimix program teaches you to safely blend helium-based trimix gases. This non-diving program covers mathematics, gas blending software, physics, and techniques required to blend breathing gases safely.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Gas Blender Nitrox

courses.name: Extended Range Nitrox Diving
courses.description: The SSI Extended Range Nitrox program provides a thorough introduction to decompression diving with nitrox. Using either a sidemount or twinset configuration, this program prepares divers to plan and conduct limited decompression dives to a maximum depth of 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Deep Diving, Enriched Air Nitrox 40, minimum 24 logged dives
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: Extended Range
courses.description: The SSI Extended Range Trimix program is the core program for technical diving. Using either a sidemount or twinset configuration, this program prepares you to plan and conduct trimix decompression dives to a maximum depth of 45 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Nitrox Diving or equivalent
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: Technical Extended Range
courses.description: The SSI Technical Extended Range Trimix program builds upon Extended Range skills by increasing dive depth and duration. Using either a sidemount or twinset configuration, plan and conduct mixed gas unlimited decompression dives to a maximum depth of 60 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range or equivalent
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended
requiredItems: Redundant dive computer or bottom timer

courses.name: Hypoxic Trimix
courses.description: The SSI Hypoxic Trimix program is the ultimate decompression dive training. Learn to carry and use a minimum of three stage-cylinders for travel and decompression gas, and plan and conduct dives to a maximum depth of 100 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Technical Extended Range or equivalent
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval required

courses.name: Extended Range Sidemount
courses.description: The SSI Extended Range Sidemount program trains you to dive in a sidemount configuration with additional stage cylinders for decompression diving. Improve your trim and streamlining for exploring overhead environments.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Recreational Sidemount Diving and Extended Range Nitrox Diving

courses.name: Extended Range Wreck Diving
courses.description: The SSI Extended Range Wreck Diving program provides all you need to plan and conduct wreck penetration dives using specialized wreck diving equipment, gas management concepts, and buddy team skills within the light zone to depths shallower than 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Wreck Diving and Extended Range Nitrox Diving

courses.name: Technical Wreck Diving
courses.description: The SSI Technical Wreck Diving program teaches you to dive the deepest wrecks with advanced penetration techniques. Plan and conduct complex wreck penetration dives beyond the light zone.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Wreck Diving and Technical Extended Range
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: Extended Range Cavern Diving
courses.description: The SSI Extended Range Cavern Diving program gives you a glimpse into the exciting world of cave diving. Learn how to use cavern diving equipment, gas management concepts, and buddy team skills to safely conduct cavern penetration dives within the daylight zone to a maximum depth of 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Nitrox Diving or equivalent

courses.name: Cave Diving
courses.description: The SSI Cave Diver certification allows you to plan and conduct cave penetration dives with a single navigational choice, using cave diving equipment. Learn the correct procedures and protocols for such dives using sidemount, twinset, or rebreather configuration.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Cavern Diving
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended
requiredItems: Line arrows, cookies, and directional markers

courses.name: Full Cave Diving
courses.description: SSI Full Cave Diving teaches you complex underwater navigation skills including traverse, jump, tee, and gap within a cave system. This is SSI's highest-level overhead environment certification, providing all the tools you need to explore the world's underwater caves to a maximum depth of 40 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Cave Diving
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval required

courses.name: Try SCR
courses.description: The SSI Try SCR program introduces you to semi-closed rebreather diving using a Mares Horizon unit. Experience the peace and extended dive times that rebreathers can bring in this introductory course.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver or equivalent

courses.name: SCR Diving
courses.description: The SSI SCR Diving course teaches you to conduct no-decompression dives up to 30 meters using the Mares Horizon semi-closed rebreather. Learn essential skills such as SCR-specific equipment configuration, gas management, and bailout procedures.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver, Enriched Air Nitrox, minimum 24 logged dives

courses.name: SCR Extended Range
courses.description: The SSI SCR Extended Range program expands your semi-closed rebreather diving to 40 meters depth, incorporating limited decompression and refining gas management techniques with the Mares Horizon.
courses.prerequisites: SSI SCR Diving

courses.name: CCR Diving
courses.description: The SSI CCR Diving program teaches you rebreather dive planning, in-water skills, problem-solving techniques, and emergency scenario management. Become comfortable with pre-dive checks, assembly, and failure handling. Allows no-decompression diving to 30 meters using SF2, JJ, Poseidon, AP Inspiration, Prism 2, or rEvo rebreathers.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver, Enriched Air Nitrox, minimum 24 logged dives
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: CCR Extended Range
courses.description: The SSI CCR Extended Range Trimix program builds upon basic rebreather skills by increasing depth, duration, introducing decompression, and adding more complex skills. Qualifies you to conduct decompression dives to a maximum depth of 45 meters using a trimix diluent.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Diving, minimum 50 logged CCR dives
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: CCR Technical Extended Range
courses.description: The SSI CCR Technical Extended Range program provides training to independently plan and conduct trimix diluent decompression dives to a maximum depth of 60 meters using a closed-circuit rebreather and a minimum of two bailout cylinders.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Extended Range, minimum 100 logged CCR dives
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval required

courses.name: CCR Hypoxic Trimix
courses.description: The SSI CCR Hypoxic Trimix program is the pinnacle of rebreather diving. Plan and conduct unlimited trimix decompression dives to a maximum depth of 100 meters using a closed-circuit rebreather and a minimum of three bailout cylinders. This elite certification is both physically and mentally challenging.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Technical Extended Range, minimum 150 logged CCR dives
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval required

courses.name: Try Freediving
courses.description: The SSI Try Freediving program provides a taste of freediving in a safe, controlled environment. Learn basic breath-hold techniques and experience the underwater world on a single breath.

courses.name: Basic Freediver
courses.description: The SSI Basic Freediver course is your first step into the world of freediving. Learn to freedive safely with a buddy in pool/confined water up to a depth of 5 meters. Cover static apnea, dynamic apnea, and rescue exercises.

courses.name: Pool Freediver
courses.description: The SSI Pool Freediver program provides all the skills and knowledge you need to freedive to a depth of 5 meters with a buddy in a pool/confined water environment. Easily upgradeable to Freediving Level 1.

courses.name: Freediver Level 1
courses.description: The SSI Freediving Level 1 program gives you all the training and knowledge you need to safely freedive with a buddy in open water environments up to a depth of 20 meters. Combines online training, pool/confined water sessions, and open water dives.

courses.name: Freediver Level 2
courses.description: The SSI Freediving Level 2 (Advanced Freediver) course allows you to discover new freediving breathing exercises, go open water freediving to 30 meters, and improve your breath holding with advanced techniques.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 1 or equivalent

courses.name: Freediver Level 3
courses.description: The SSI Freediving Level 3 program teaches you the techniques of a freediving world record holder. This program provides advanced freediving skills and knowledge to dive up to 40 meters deep with a buddy.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 2 or equivalent
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval recommended

courses.name: Performance Freediver
courses.description: The SSI Performance Freediver certification is the highest level of non-professional freediving course SSI offers. Learn the techniques used in the competitive freediving world and maximize your skills to discover your true freediving potential.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 3 or equivalent
courses.medicalRequirements: SSI Medical Statement required, physician approval required

courses.name: Monofin Freediving
courses.description: The SSI Monofin Freediving specialty teaches monofin swimming, allowing you to enjoy increased speed, power, and confidence while maximizing underwater efficiency for better freediving performance.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 1 or equivalent

courses.name: Training Techniques
courses.description: The SSI Training Techniques specialty teaches exercises to do at home and in the water to progress faster in freediving training. Discover your strengths and weaknesses and create a personalized training plan.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 1 or equivalent

courses.name: Try Mermaid
courses.description: The SSI Try Mermaid program provides a great introductory mermaid experience in confined waters. Learn the first skills involved in becoming a mermaid and swim with a tail.

courses.name: Mermaid
courses.description: The SSI Mermaid program provides students with the knowledge and training to autonomously conduct mermaid activities with an equally or more qualified buddy in a pool/confined water environment, and to depths shallower than 5 meters.

courses.name: Ocean Mermaid
courses.description: The SSI Ocean Mermaid program provides all the skills and techniques you need to maximize your mermaid experience in open water. Take your mermaid adventures to the oceans with 2 additional open water sessions.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Mermaid

courses.name: Model Mermaid
courses.description: The SSI Model Mermaid program teaches you to pose for the perfect underwater photo and perfect your mermaid presentation skills. Learn professional underwater modeling techniques.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Mermaid

courses.name: Dive Guide
courses.description: The SSI Dive Guide program is your entry into the professional diving world. Learn to guide certified divers underwater safely while developing leadership and customer service skills.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Diver, Deep Diving, Navigation, Night Diving & Limited Visibility (or 5 logged dives in each area), Diver Stress & Rescue, minimum 40 logged dives

courses.name: Divemaster
courses.description: Transform your passion for diving into a career with the SSI Divemaster program. Guide certified divers, teach Ecology specialties, assist instructors, and explore endless opportunities. Requires completion of Dive Guide, Science of Diving, and minimum 60 logged dives.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Dive Guide, Science of Diving, minimum 60 logged dives

courses.name: Assistant Instructor
courses.description: The SSI Assistant Instructor program is the next step after becoming a Divemaster. Assist instructors with open water diver courses and collect valuable teaching experience while working toward becoming a diving instructor.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Divemaster or equivalent

courses.name: Instructor Training Course
courses.description: The SSI Instructor Training Course (ITC) is a comprehensive program that is part of SSI's 2-Step Instructor Training Approach. After completing the ITC, you attend the Instructor Evaluation (IE) to become an SSI Open Water Instructor.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Divemaster or equivalent qualification

courses.name: Open Water Instructor
courses.description: As an SSI Open Water Instructor, you can independently teach key SSI programs including Open Water Diver, Advanced Open Water Diver, Enriched Air Nitrox, Diver Stress & Rescue, and Dive Guide. This certification is earned after completing the ITC and Instructor Evaluation.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Instructor Training Course completion

courses.name: Specialty Instructor
courses.description: The SSI Specialty Instructor program allows you to expand your teaching offerings by becoming qualified to teach specific SSI Specialty programs. Increase your value as a dive professional.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Instructor, current certification in the relevant specialty

courses.name: Advanced Open Water Instructor
courses.description: The SSI Advanced Open Water Instructor is a professional recognition earned by completing multiple specialty instructor certifications and gaining teaching experience. Teach a wider range of programs.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Instructor, 4 Specialty Instructor certifications, 25 certified students

courses.name: Divemaster Instructor
courses.description: The SSI Divemaster Instructor qualification allows you to teach Dive Guide and Divemaster programs. Guide the next generation of dive professionals.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Advanced Open Water Instructor, 50 certified students

courses.name: Master Instructor
courses.description: SSI Master Instructor is a professional recognition earned through continued education and teaching experience. Demonstrates exceptional commitment to the diving industry.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Divemaster Instructor, 8 Specialty Instructor certifications, 100 certified students

courses.name: Assistant Instructor Trainer
courses.description: The SSI Assistant Instructor Trainer program allows you to assist Instructor Trainers in conducting all SSI Instructor-level programs. Make an essential contribution to the diving industry by teaching future instructors.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Master Instructor or equivalent, assisted in 1 ITC

courses.name: Instructor Trainer
courses.description: The SSI Instructor Trainer is the final step in SSI's Instructor Training Pathway. Join the most elite dive instructors in the industry and teach the entire range of SSI recreational diving courses, conduct the ITC, and Instructor Crossovers.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Master Instructor, assisted in 1 ITC and 1 Professional Crossover

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Level 1
courses.description: As an SSI Freediving Instructor Level 1, utilize innovative training techniques to introduce new freedivers to the world of breath-hold diving. Teach all entry-level programs along with Free Immersion and Training Techniques specialties.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediver Level 2 or equivalent, minimum 50 logged freedives

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Level 2
courses.description: The SSI Freediving Instructor Level 2 (Advanced Freediving Instructor) certification allows you to increase your freediving certification offerings and introduce customers to the basics of competitive freediving.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediving Instructor Level 1, minimum 100 logged freedives

courses.name: Performance Freediving Instructor
courses.description: The SSI Performance Freediving Instructor is the apex of the SSI freediving system. After certifying 50 students from different levels, join other elite freediving instructors with this upgrade.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Freediving Instructor Level 2, 50 certified students

courses.name: Freediving Instructor Trainer
courses.description: Join an elite group of exceptional freedivers as an SSI Freediving Instructor Trainer. Train and certify the next generation of freediving instructors worldwide.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Performance Freediving Instructor, minimum 150 certified students

courses.name: Mermaid Instructor
courses.description: Become an SSI Mermaid Instructor and share your knowledge teaching students how to enjoy all bodies of water using their mermaid tails. Work at SSI Training Centers in over 150 countries.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Ocean Mermaid, SSI React Right, minimum 18 years old

courses.name: Mermaid Instructor Trainer
courses.description: Become an SSI Mermaid Instructor Trainer and teach others how to become professional mermaids. Train mermaid instructors worldwide with this globally recognized certification.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Mermaid Instructor, minimum 25 certified mermaid students

courses.name: Lifeguard
courses.description: The SSI Lifeguard certification teaches exciting new skills including communication, problem solving, and teamwork. Become a professional lifeguard with SSI's globally recognized lifeguard training.
courses.prerequisites: Strong swimming ability, SSI React Right or equivalent first aid certification

courses.name: Lifeguard Instructor
courses.description: As an SSI Lifeguard Instructor, you can join water safety teams around the world and make training lifeguards your full-time career. A fun and rewarding profession.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Lifeguard certification, minimum 18 years old

courses.name: Lifeguard Instructor Trainer
courses.description: Upgrade your SSI certification with the Lifeguard Instructor Trainer program. Teach and certify all levels of the SSI Lifeguard and SSI Lifeguard Instructor courses.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Lifeguard Instructor, minimum 25 certified students

courses.name: Extended Range Nitrox Diving Instructor
courses.description: Start your Extended Range career by becoming an SSI Extended Range Nitrox Diving Instructor. Teach divers to conduct limited decompression dives to 40 meters using nitrox.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Nitrox Diving, SSI Open Water Instructor, minimum 100 logged dives

courses.name: Technical Extended Range Instructor
courses.description: Grow your technical diver career by becoming an SSI Technical Extended Range Trimix Instructor. Teach advanced technical diving to 60 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Technical Extended Range, SSI Extended Range Instructor, minimum 200 logged dives

courses.name: Hypoxic Trimix Instructor
courses.description: Teach SSI Hypoxic Trimix diving and certify students for multiple-gas switch, multiple-stop, decompression dives up to a maximum depth of 100 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Hypoxic Trimix, SSI Technical Extended Range Instructor, minimum 300 logged dives including 50 trimix dives

courses.name: CCR Instructor
courses.description: Train rebreather divers and sharpen your skills by becoming an SSI CCR Diving Instructor. Teach unit-specific CCR programs.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Diving, SSI Open Water Instructor, minimum 100 logged CCR dives

courses.name: CCR Technical Extended Range Instructor
courses.description: Continue your CCR training and become an SSI CCR Technical Extended Range Instructor. Teach advanced CCR diving to 60 meters.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Technical Extended Range, SSI CCR Instructor, minimum 200 logged CCR dives

courses.name: CCR Hypoxic Trimix Instructor
courses.description: Teach SSI CCR Hypoxic Trimix diving and certify students for the ultimate rebreather dives to 100 meters depth.
courses.prerequisites: SSI CCR Hypoxic Trimix, SSI CCR Technical Extended Range Instructor, minimum 300 logged CCR dives

courses.name: Extended Range Cavern Diving Instructor
courses.description: Become an SSI Extended Range Cavern Diving Instructor and certify SSI Recreational Cavern/Cenote Diving and Extended Range Cavern Diving courses.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Extended Range Cavern Diving, SSI Extended Range Instructor, minimum 100 cavern/cave dives

courses.name: Cave Diving Instructor
courses.description: Become an SSI Cave Diving Instructor and train the next generation of cave divers. Teach cave penetration techniques and safety protocols.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Full Cave Diving, SSI Extended Range Cavern Diving Instructor, minimum 200 cave dives

courses.name: Extended Range Instructor Trainer
courses.description: Become an SSI Extended Range Instructor Trainer for open circuit, rebreather, and overhead environment diving. Train the next generation of technical diving instructors.
courses.prerequisites: Multiple SSI Extended Range Instructor certifications, minimum 500 logged technical dives

courses.name: SCR Diving Instructor
courses.description: Train rebreather divers and sharpen your skills by becoming an SSI SCR Diving Instructor. Teach Mares Horizon semi-closed rebreather programs.
courses.prerequisites: SSI SCR Extended Range, SSI Open Water Instructor, minimum 50 logged SCR dives

courses.name: Ecology Specialty Instructor
courses.description: Become an SSI Ecology Specialty Instructor and teach marine life ecology programs. Share your passion for ocean conservation and marine biology.
courses.prerequisites: SSI Open Water Instructor, relevant ecology specialty certification
